basics.name: Thomas J. Maierhofer
basics.position: Lecturer, UCLA Department of Statistics & Data Science
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

_work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
_work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

_awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
_awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'
